titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Printed Ephemera Collection of Oversized Material PE.040
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Adrien Hilton

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-03-29T15:13-0400

did.unittitle: Printed Ephemera Collection of Oversized Material
did.abstract: The Printed Ephemera Collection of Oversized Material is an artificial collection, collected and assembled by the Tamiment Library over the course of several decades. It includes material related to other Printed Ephemera Collections at the Tamiment Library. Most of the material corresponds to organizations in PE 036, trade unions in PE 001, or individuals in PE 030.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Items are arranged alphabetically within folders.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2630
Fax: (212) 995-4225
E-mail: peter.filardo@nyu.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number;
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The provenance of the materials is varied. Items were obtained through purchases, donations, standing orders with publishers, arrangements with labor unions and other organizations, exchanges with other libraries, and through ongoing collecting by Tamiment staff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Printed Ephemera Collection of Oversized Material consists of large-scale items, which relate to other Printed Ephemera Collections at the Tamiment Library. These items were separated from collections and housed in appropriate containers because of their size. There are fliers, leaflets, broadsides, pamphlets and other publications in the collection. Items correspond to organizations such as the American Labor Party, the Black Panther Party, the Labour Party of Great Britain, the Workers Defense Union and the Committee for Maritime Unity. There are also items published by unions, for instance, materials relating to the International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union, the United Federation of Teachers, and the International Brotherhood of Teamsters. The material ranges in date from the late 1880s to 1999.
